data.title: Famous People Born in October 1953
data.meta_description: Celebrate the birthdays of 69 famous people, historical figures and celebrities born in October 1953 like Grete Waitz, Pat Day and Keith Hernandez.
data.text:
Grete Waitz

Norwegian long distance athlete (9 x NYC Marathon titles; World C'ship gold 1983; 5 x gold World Cross Country; WR x 4), born in Oslo, Norway

John Hegley, British poet

Oct 1 Larry Miller, American comedian and character actor (Dream On; Mad About You; The Princess Diaries; Dilbert), and columnist, born in Brooklyn, New York City

Ernest Bai Koroma, Sierra Leonean politician, President of Sierra Leone (2007-), born in Makeni, Sierra Leone

Karen Bass, American politician and social worker (1st woman elected Mayor of Los Angeles 2022-; Rep-(D)-California 2011-2022), born in Los Angeles, California

Andreas Vollenweider, Swiss new-age harpist (Down to the Moon), born in Zürich, Switzerland

Oct 4 Gil "The Bird" Moore, Canadian rock drummer and vocalist (Triumph), born in Toronto, Ontario [some sources give birth date as Feb. 12, 1951]

Oct 4 Tchéky Karyo, Turkish-French actor

James Lascelles, British grandson of English princess Mary, born in Bayswater, London

Oct 5 John Stachniewski, scholar and teacher at Manchester University (UK) (d. 1996)

Oct 5 Sandra "Puma" Jones, American reggae singer (Black Uhuru, 1979-86), born in Columbia, South Carolina (d. 1990)

Klaas Bruinsma, Dutch drug lord (d. 1991)

(Hector) "Tico" Torres, American rock drummer (Bon Jovi - "Livin' On A Prayer"; "It's My Life"), and painter, born in New York City

Oct 7 Christopher Norris, American actress (Summer of '42, Eat My Dust), born in New York City

Ricky Lee Phelps, American singer (Kentucky Headhunters - "The Ballad Of Davy Crockett"), born in Paragould, Arkansas

Oct 8 Robert Saxton, British classical composer (The Circle of Light; Caritas), born in London

Hank Pfister, American tennis star, born in Bakersfield, California

Oct 9 Tony Shalhoub, American actor (Wings, Monk, The Marvelous Mrs. Maisel), born in Green Bay, Wisconsin

(James) "Midge" Ure, Scottish singer-songwriter, guitarist, and synth player ("Dear God"; Ultravox - "We Came to Dance"; Band Aid - "Do They Know It's Christmas?"), born in Glasgow, Scotland

Oct 10 Gus Williams, American NBA guard (Golden State, Seattle, Washington), born in Mount Vernon, New York

David Morse, American actor (St Elsewhere, House, Inside Moves), born in Beverly, Massachusetts

Serge Lepeltier, French politician, born in Le Veurdre, Allier, France

Bill Schuette, American lawyer and politician (53rd Attorney General of Michigan), born in Midland, Michigan

Pat Day

American thoroughbred jockey (9 x winner of the American Triple Crown; 6 x US Champion in wins; 2 x US Champion in earnings; $298m career purses), born in Brush, Colorado

Greg Evigan, American actor (BJ & the Bear: Melrose Place), born in South Amboy, New Jersey

Oct 14 Kazumi Watanabe, Japanese jazz and jazz-fusion guitarist, born in Tokyo, Japan

Oct 14 Marcel Zeeuw, Surinamese soldier (participant in the Sergeant Coup, 1982), born in Paramaribo, Suriname (d. 2015)

Oct 14 Roland Butcher, English cricket batsman (3 Tests; 1st cricketer of Caribbean descent to play for England; Middlesex CCC, Barbados, Tasmania, Suffolk CCC), born in Saint Philip Parish, Barbados

Oct 14 Shelley Ackerman, American astrologer, writer and singer, born in Manhattan, New York

Betsy Clifford, Canadian alpine skier, born in Ottawa, Ontario

Oct 15 Joe Klecko, American Pro Football HOF defensive lineman (NFL Defensive Player of the Year 1981; First-team All-Pro 1981, 85; 4 × Pro Bowl; New York Jets), born in Chester, Pennsylvania

Oct 15 Larry Miller, American comedian and actor (Larry-Pursuit Of Happiness), born in New York City

Oct 15 Tito Jackson, American singer (Jackson 5 - "ABC"; "Never Can Say Goodbye"), born in Gary, Indiana

Martha Smith, American actress (Animal House) and model (Playboy playmate July 1973), born in Cleveland, Ohio

Oct 16 Paulo Roberto Falcão, Brazilian footballer

Oct 16 Susan Pedersen, American 4 X 100m medley swimmer (Olympic gold 1968)

Oct 16 Tony Carey, American rock keyboardist, and singer-songwriter (Rainbow; Planet P Project), born in Watsonville, California

Bill Nunn, American actor (Do the Right Thing), born in Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania (d. 2016)

Keith Hernandez

American MLB 1st baseman (St Louis Cardinals, NY Mets), born in San Francisco, California

Charlotte Caffey, American rock guitarist, keyboardist, and vocalist (The Go-Go's - "We Got The Beat"), born in Santa Monica, California

Oct 21 Eleonora Giorgi, actress (Nu de Femme, To Forget Venice), born in Rome, Italy

Oct 21 Keith Green, American contemporary Christian music singer-songwriter and pianist ("There Is a Redeemer"; "(Until) Your Love Broke Through"), and minister, born in Brooklyn, NYC (d. 1982)

Oct 21 Peter Mandelson, British politician

Gary Wilson, American experimental musician and performance artist (You Think You Really Know Me), born in Endicott, New York

Oct 23 Pauline Black [Belinda Magnus], English ska singer (Selecter -"On My Radio"), born in Romford, East London

Billy Thomas, American singer (McBride & Ride - "I Count on You"), born in Fort Meyers, Florida

Oct 24 James di Donato, open water swimmer, one of the Tiger Twins (world record for swimming the butterfly in 40.6 miles)

Oct 24 Jonathan di Donato, open water swimmer, one of the Tiger Twins (world record for swimming the butterfly in 40.6 miles)

Mark McNulty, Irish-Zimbabwean golfer (The Tradition 2007; 16 European Tour titles), born in Bindura, Zimbabwe

Oct 25 Muffin Spencer-Devlin, American golfer (3 LPGA Tour titles), born in Piqua, Ohio

Jennifer Roberson, American sci-fi author (Shapechangers, Sword-Maker), born in Kansas City, Missouri

Oct 26 Julian Keith Strickland, American drummer (B-52's - "Rock Lobster"), born in Athens, Georgia

Oct 26 Lauren Tewes, American actress (Julie McCoy-Love Boat), born in Braddock, Pennsylvania

Oct 26 Rosa Monckton, English businesswoman and notable charity fundraiser, born in Westminster, London

Michael Baker, Lt Cmdr USN/astronaut (STS 43, 52, 68, 81), born in Memphis, Tennessee

Oct 27 Peter Firth, English actor (Equus, Lifeforce, Tess), born in Bradford, England

Oct 27 Robert Picardo, American actor (Frame Up, Gremlins 2), born in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania

Desmond Child [John Barrett], American-Hungarian songwriter (Bon Jovi - "You Give Love a Bad Name", "Livin' on a Prayer"; Aerosmith - "Dude (Looks Like a Lady)"; Ricky Martin - "Livin' la Vida Loca"), and producer, born in Gainesville, Florida

Oct 28 Mark James, British golfer (Senior Players Championship 2004), born in Manchester, England

Oct 28 Phil Dwyer, Welsh soccer defender (10 caps; Cardiff City 471 games), born in Cardiff, Wales (d. 2021)

Oct 28 Pierre Boivin, Canadian businessman and hockey executive

Denis Potvin

Canadian born NHL defenseman (NY Islanders - Norris trophy), born in Vanier, Ontario

(Piet) "Pete" Hoekstra, Dutch-American politician (Rep-R-Michigan, 1993-11; US Ambassador to the Netherlands, 2018-21), born in Groningen, Netherlands

Oct 30 Alexander Fedorovich Poleshchuk, Russian cosmonaut (Soyuz TM-16), born in Moscow, Russia

Oct 30 Charles Martin Smith, American actor (American Graffiti, Never Cry Wolf), born in Van Nuys, California

Oct 30 Desmond Fitzgerald, Irish medical doctor and President of the University of Limerick (2017-20), born in Dublin

Oct 30 Kathleen Cody, American actress (Charley & the Angel), born in The Bronx, New York

John Lucas, NBA guard (Houston, Golden State, Milwaukee), born in Durham, North Carolina

Oct 31 Michael J. Anderson, American actor (The Man from Another Place), born in Denver, Coloroda

About October 1953

How Old? 70 years old

Generation: Baby Boomer

Leap Year: No

Chinese Zodiac: Snake

Star Signs: Libra (Sep 23 - Oct 22), Scorpio (Oct 23 - Nov 21)
